
A careless admin reused a prime to encrypt two secret messages via RSA. Decrypt the hidden flag: 1038540490870289641512950553908485515429935320915702990287990194548851306885903686755270229225149914100618335427817186243054420666563507021752377011440178438297120283299596004833261509197977204855271892326881104983529861705807208378


The flag format is flag{...}
n=1182743613171349335976761738103876849184807230975958887112578636187423899835855170660273373275963480237494637468094133000543250983102588056595111507164018685381768157299875756202160021874654734730418176417552749141514702214500854441, e=855676497078663225792731955057558512747140123510590764680061265927932727057948440962668510955345876224555226960559471721269761603388570272228020776459154500635145935304393730581171542654414953832798180275815658680060155116687645313

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{1odqeyil}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 1038540490870289641512950553908485515429935320915702990287990194548851306885903686755270229225149914100618335427817186243054420666563507021752377011440178438297120283299596004833261509197977204855271892326881104983529861705807208378
vulnerability: repeated primes
hint: The RSA modulus n is a perfect square. This often indicates a repeated prime usage vulnerability.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=1182743613171349335976761738103876849184807230975958887112578636187423899835855170660273373275963480237494637468094133000543250983102588056595111507164018685381768157299875756202160021874654734730418176417552749141514702214500854441, e=855676497078663225792731955057558512747140123510590764680061265927932727057948440962668510955345876224555226960559471721269761603388570272228020776459154500635145935304393730581171542654414953832798180275815658680060155116687645313
